paper_abstract: Age plays an important role in the transmission of some infectious diseases. A discrete SEIT model with age-structure is formulated and studied. The basic reproduction number, R-0, of the model is defined. It is proved that R-0 = 1 is a threshold to determine the disease extinction or persistence. The disease- free equilibrium is globally stable (unstable) if R-0 < 1 (if R-0 > 1). There exists an endemic equilibrium, and the system is uniformly persistent if R-0 > 1. The numerical simulation demonstrates that the endemic equilibrium may be globally asymptotically stable. The model is applied to describe tuberculosis (TB) transmission in China. The total number of the population, the incidence rate, the prevalent rate and its age structure match the statistical data well. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The discrete age-structured SEIT model with application to tuberculosis transmission in China
